meanings.definition: Comparative form of techy: irritable or easily annoyed
meanings.sent1: She became even techier when her computer crashed for the third time.
meanings.sent2: He is getting techier as the day goes on, snapping at everyone around him.
meanings.sent3: The techier she got, the more mistakes she made trying to fix the problem.
meanings.sent4: His techier mood was like a storm brewing on the horizon, ready to unleash its fury.
meanings.sent5: The techier he became, the more people avoided him like a prickly cactus.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of techy: relating to or knowledgeable about technology
meanings.sent1: She is the techier of the two sisters when it comes to fixing gadgets.
meanings.sent2: The techier students in the class were the first to finish the assignment.
meanings.sent3: His techier side emerged when he started explaining complex coding concepts in simple terms.
meanings.sent4: Her techier skills were a shining beacon in the sea of technological confusion.
meanings.sent5: The techier he became, the more he immersed himself in the world of digital innovation.
